TopicTitle: Once on launchpad, how to return to VAB?

Articles.Content:
I've tried searching for two days, but anytime I go to launch and realize I need to fix my spacecraft, I can't find any manner to return to the VAB or even to exit out of the game.

I've been stuck on this for two days. To accomplish this, I use ctrl-alt-delete.

Can't believe it has taken this long for someone to reply... You need to hit escape and select end flight, from there is an option to return to the VAB. Hope it works out for you.

Edited July 16, 2013 by Trux
Early mornings are not fun

If you want to keep the rocket on the launch pad you should be able to just ESC and select space center.

In one video I saw lately the player liked to drive his crewmen from the airfield to the pad in a rover and let them climb up to the command pod.

Ha ha I had the same problem early on and a few other palm to forehead moments. The Wiki can be very helpfull.

Like Trux said escape will give you various options on the pad and in flight. BE WARNED it can be very easy to unintentional end flights and loose missions you have put much time into. Ps f5 to quick save and hold f9 to load quicksave.
The escape key is universally used for one thing only and that is to show some kind of menu to let you exit or to immediately exit.

The escape key is universally used for one thing only and that is to show some kind of menu to let you exit or to immediately exit.

The way this was phrased made me think of this xkcd comic...

Escape doesn't work for me. Also when I hit f5 to save or f9, I receive an error message telling me that neither will work "in this scenario", whatever scenario I'm in.

There might be one conflict that is on my end, though. I've found with one game that Adobe Photoshop 5 hijacks the escape button if it's open at the same time as the other game. This could be the issue here, too.

There obviously is an issue, escape is the button you'Re looking for. I,m not sure it's configurable, but check in the settings menu to be sure that the menu is linked to escape. Else try closing every program in the background.

If you want to keep the rocket on the launch pad you should be able to just ESC and select space center.

In one video I saw lately the player liked to drive his crewmen from the airfield to the pad in a rover and let them climb up to the command pod.

Smarter to just create an simple rover in WAB, drive it off the launchpad, exit them without ending flight and start the next one.

Nice if you want to fill up ship with more crew or even if you want to evacuate an test or rescue ship before launching.
I think that would fail the presumably intended goal for immersion.
Only reason why escape wouldn't work that I could think of is if your ship is throttled up; hit X first and see if that has any effect.
